item.title: By: T
item.dc:creator: T
item.description: You should consider honey rather than sugar. 1 to 2 tbsp will do. Also, a key ingredient is missing. Tandoori colour (a spice)! The tandoori is crucial to the chicken marinade.
item.content:encoded: You should consider honey rather than sugar. 1 to 2 tbsp will do. Also, a key ingredient is missing. Tandoori colour (a spice)! The tandoori is crucial to the chicken marinade.

item.title: By: Rachael
item.dc:creator: Rachael
item.description: Hi, I will have to try this recipe one day also you are great at what you do you should really do this as a living if you dont already. I have a butter chicken recipe which is similar but uses peppercorns cloves bay leaves Tomato onion cream fenugreek leaves for the curry. tandori masala greek yoghurt ginger and garlic for the marinade for the chicken and you bake the chicken in the oven. Maybe you could try that one out? Not trying to tell you how to cook though you obviously know how :)
item.content:encoded:
Hi, I will have to try this recipe one day also you are great at what you do you should really do this as a living if you dont already. I have a butter chicken recipe which is similar but uses peppercorns cloves bay leaves Tomato onion cream fenugreek leaves for the curry. tandori masala greek yoghurt ginger and garlic for the marinade for the chicken and you bake the chicken in the oven. Maybe you could try that one out?
Not trying to tell you how to cook though you obviously know how ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Anita
item.dc:creator: Anita
item.description:
Hi everyone, thanks for the kind comments!!
Hi Lorraine - yes it was an Indian Restaurant... haven't been back...
Hi Clekitty - glad to see you enjoy blogs like this. I like to hear what people think of recipes too, before I potentially waste time...
item.content:encoded:
Hi everyone, thanks for the kind comments!!

Hi Lorraine – yes it was an Indian Restaurant… haven’t been back…

Hi Clekitty – glad to see you enjoy blogs like this. I like to hear what people think of recipes too, before I potentially waste time…

item.title: By: clekitty
item.dc:creator: clekitty
item.description: Thanks for sharing the recipe! I love food blogs like yours where someone has tested and tried the recipe as then I have the confidence/motivation to try it out for myself :)
item.content:encoded: Thanks for sharing the recipe! I love food blogs like yours where someone has tested and tried the recipe as then I have the confidence/motivation to try it out for myself ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Zita
item.dc:creator: Zita
item.description: Never thought of crushed cashew in a sauce, I do alot of peanuts sauce for meals but how come not cashew?... mm interesting, thank's for sharing :)
item.content:encoded: Never thought of crushed cashew in a sauce, I do alot of peanuts sauce for meals but how come not cashew?… mm interesting, thank’s for sharing ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Barbara

item.description: I have never heard of butter chicken. It sounds delicious. In the last picture it looks fantastic.
item.content:encoded: I have never heard of butter chicken. It sounds delicious. In the last picture it looks fantastic.

item.title: By: Alexandra@Chefspiration
item.dc:creator: Alexandra@Chefspiration
item.description: This sounds very rich and tasty...but tomato and maple syrup...gag!
item.content:encoded: This sounds very rich and tasty…but tomato and maple syrup…gag!

item.title: By: Lorraine @ Not Quite Nigella
item.dc:creator: Lorraine @ Not Quite Nigella
item.description: That looks very good indeed and looks like not a single drop of tomato sauce or maple syrup has touched it (eek that sounds terrible, was that at a real Indian restaurant?)
item.content:encoded: That looks very good indeed and looks like not a single drop of tomato sauce or maple syrup has touched it (eek that sounds terrible, was that at a real Indian restaurant?)

item.title: By: Arwen from Hoglet K
item.dc:creator: Arwen from Hoglet K
item.description: That's an impressive list of spices! The crushed cashews sound good too.
item.content:encoded: That’s an impressive list of spices! The crushed cashews sound good too.
